combination.description: Valid combination of keystrokes to trigger command.

functionalArea.description: Functional ares that keystrokes are assigned to.

schemaUrl.description: Location of applicable provider JSON schema.

legacyVersion.description: The version number used in Deneb 1.0, prior to doing comparisons. From 1.1. onwards, this is persisted to the visual properties, so we can determine compatibility.

patch.description: Power BI & provider-specific patches for specifications.

showCustomVisualNotes.description: Display information about the custom visual limitations and recommendations for end users.

IDeveloperDefaults.description: Default values for visual developer properties.

locale.description: Default locale used for format debugging.

showVersionNotification.description: Show the "New Version" notification in the editor.

IEditorDefaults.description: For the Ace editor used with `jsoneditor`, this object tracks any configuration values that aren't covered in any logic or properties elsewhere.

debounceInterval.description: Time (in ms) before debouncing user input to store. The longer the interval, the less chatty things are, but the longer the perceived lag for things to happen after the user finishes typing in the editor.

tabSize.description: Number of tabs to apply per level when formatting JSON.

wordWrap.description: Whether to wrap text in the editor onto new lines, or not.

showGutter.description: Whether to show the gutter in the editor (used for displaying line numbers and expand/collapse markers for nested objects).

showLineNumbers.description: Display line numbers in the gutter.

showViewportMarker.description: Whether to show viewport marker for actual size of visual prior to opening editor.

maxLineLength.description: Number of characters to try to cap lines at when prettifying JSON.

IThemeDefaults.description: Property defaults for any theme integration with the Vega view.

ordinalColorCount.description: The number of discrete colors to use when computing the pbiColorOrdinal scheme.

ordinalColorCountMin.description: Minimum allowed number of colors to assign to ordinal scheme (if specifying manually).

ordinalColorCountMax.description: Maximum allowed number of colors to assign to ordinal scheme (if specifying manually).

IPerformanceDefaults.description: Property defaults for any performance tuning settings.

enableResizeRecalc.description: If disabled, Deneb will delay recalculation of visual logic until a resize operation has been completed.

selectionMaxDataPoints.description: The maximum number of underlying data points that can be supplied to Power BI's selection manager. Too many can cause performance issues, so this will block the visual from grabbing more than it should.

tooltipDelay.description: When the ctrl key is held, this will delay the display of the tooltip by the specified number of milliseconds.

isNewDialogOpen.description: Indicates that the new specification should show when advanced editor is opened.

unitTestCanary.description: Used to validate unit testing functionality. Should always be `false`.

developerMode.description: Provides a means of enabling developer-specific functionality independent of debugging.

enableExternalUri.description: Enable external URIs in specifications for data and images - if enabled, we'll preserve any URI/URL-based content in specifications and config, although these will be subject to the standard CORS limitations that custom visuals are subject to. If disabled, then we process text for any occurrences of a URI and strip it out (except for `data:` URIs).

fetchMoreData.description: Enables the Fetch More Data API and Data Limit property menu functionality.

selectionContextMenu.description: Enables the Power BI context menu to display on data points (if they can be resolved) via Visual Editor settings. This currently only works for single view Vega-Lite specifications and needs further R&D.

selectionDataPoint.description: Enables the Power BI selection manager to accept signals from Vega-Lite selections and (if they resolve to the `dataView`) cross-highlight other visuals. Visual authors will need to apply their own visual encoding of selections to indicate which points are currently selected.

selectionCrossHighlight.description: Enables functionality for cross-highlight binding to dataset (provided that `supportsHighlight` is also enabled in visual capabilities).

tooltipHandler.description: Allows custom `TooltipHandler` to be enabled via Visual Editor settings. This will resolve tooltips for data points using the Power BI tooltip APIs based on signals from Vega/Vega-Lite.

tooltipResolveNumberFieldFormat.description: If a field in a Vega tooltip's `datum` object is present in the `tooltip` object, attempt to find a corresponding field name in the visual dataset metadata, and get its format string (if not already formatted in the spec).

useDownloadApi.description: Use the Power BI download API to offer downloading of template files.

templateExportPreviewImages.description: Allow the option to include a preview image when generating export templates.

keyBindings.description: Shortcut key combinations for visual commands and operations.

applyChanges.description: Command to apply editor changes to visual properties.

autoApplyToggle.description: Command to enable auto-apply of changes in the editor.

repairFormatJson.description: Command to repair and format JSON in the editors.

newTemplate.description: Command to open the exportable template dialog.

newSpecification.description: Command to open the new specification dialog.

mapFields.description: Command to open field mapping dialog.

openHelpUrl.description: Command to navigate to the documentation site.

navigateSpecification.description: Command to set focus to the Specification editor.

navigateConfig.description: Command to set focus to the Config editor.

navigateSettings.description: Command to set focus to the Settings pane.

toggleEditorPane.description: Command to toggle display of the Editor pane.

editorFocusOut.description: Command to focus out of editor and back to main pane.

zoomFit.description: Set zoom level to fit visual.

templates.description: Used to manage handling of template functionality.

previewImageSize.description: Numbe rof pixels to use for generating preview images

providerResources.description: Embedded versions - used to help automate the packaged Vega and Vega-Lite versions on the visual's landing page, plus URLs or resources that we might want to expose to the user within the visual.

deneb.description: Supporting resources for Deneb as a whole.

legacyVersion.description: The version number used in Deneb 1.0, prior to doing comparisons. From 1.1. onwards, this is persisted to the visual properties, so we can determine compatibility.

selection.description: Settings for managing zoom level configuration when working with rendered visual output in the visual editor

dataPointsStepValue.description: Amount to step by when using the spin control for max data points.

splitPaneDefaults.description: For the Editor pane, we're using `react-split-pane` to allow the author to resize it. This object specifies the sizes we should allow for this pane within the visual viewport.

minSize.description: Minimum allowed size of expanded editor pane (px).

defaultSizePercent.description: Default percentage of viewport to allocate for the expanded editor pane.

maxSizePercent.description: Maximum percentage of viewport to allow for the expanded editor pane.

collapsedSize.description: The width of the collapsed editor pane (px).

visualViewPortAdjust.description: For the rendered Vega spec, how much spacing (in px) to apply to the visual, within its visible area.

zoomLevel.description: Settings for managing zoom level configuration when working with rendered visual output in the visual editor

step.description: Amount to step by when clicking or dragging the zoom slider.

modalDialog.description: Settings for modal dialog display within the visual editor.

heightPercent.description: Percentage of viewport to use for dialog height.

widthPercent.description: Percentage of viewport to use for dialog height.
